definitions: remaining in one place without movement or change of position
relating to paper, envelopes, and other materials used for writing
examples: The car remained stationary at the traffic light
The stationary train waited for clearance to proceed
She bought stationary from the office supply store
The company's stationary featured their new logo design

definitions: relating to or suitable for statues or the art of making them
examples: The museum displayed remarkable statuary art from ancient Greece
The garden featured statuary figures of mythological creatures

definitions: required, permitted, or enacted by statute or law rather than common practice
examples: Employers must provide statutory sick pay to eligible workers
The company met all statutory requirements for safety standards

definitions: very loyal and committed in attitude showing firm support
substantial, strong, or steadfast in construction or character
examples: She remained a staunch supporter of environmental causes
His staunch defense of civil rights never wavered
The castle's staunch walls withstood centuries of weather
They built a staunch barrier against the flooding river

definitions: resolutely or dutifully firm and unwavering in purpose or loyalty
examples: Her steadfast determination helped her overcome every obstacle
The soldiers showed steadfast courage during the long siege

definitions: behaving or done in a cautious and surreptitious manner to avoid detection
examples: The cat made a stealthy approach toward the unsuspecting bird
The spy used stealthy movements to avoid security cameras

definitions: cooked by the heat of steam from boiling water
feeling or showing anger or strong annoyance about something
examples: The restaurant served perfectly steamed vegetables with the meal
She prepared steamed dumplings for the dinner party
He was really steamed about the parking ticket
The customers were steamed when their flight was cancelled

definitions: producing or giving off steam or vapor from heat
very hot in temperature, often uncomfortably so
feeling or expressing intense anger or frustration
examples: The steaming coffee mug warmed her cold hands
We saw steaming geysers during our Yellowstone visit
It was a steaming summer day in the city
The steaming pavement burned through our thin shoes
She was steaming mad about the unfair decision
The coach was steaming after the referee's bad call

definitions: hot and humid with visible moisture in the air
depicting or involving passionate sexual activity or strong romantic content
examples: The steamy jungle air made breathing difficult for hikers
The bathroom became steamy after the hot shower
The novel contained several steamy romance scenes
They shared a steamy kiss in the moonlight

definitions: resembling steel in color, hardness, or strength
showing cold determination or strength of character without emotion
examples: The sky turned a steely gray before the storm
His steely muscles showed years of hard training
She fixed him with a steely gaze of disapproval
His steely resolve never faltered during the crisis

definitions: capable of being steered, guided, or directed in movement or course
examples: The new car features highly steerable front wheels
The steerable parachute allowed for precise landing control

definitions: relating to or consisting of stars or star-like celestial objects
exceptionally good, outstanding, or excellent in performance or quality
examples: The telescope revealed stellar formations millions of lightyears away
Astronomers study stellar evolution throughout the universe
She gave a stellar performance in the lead role
The restaurant received stellar reviews from food critics

definitions: having a stem removed or attached, or originating from a particular source
examples: The florist arranged long stemmed roses in the vase
The stemmed wine glasses sparkled on the dining table

definitions: proceeding or changing by steps or degrees in a gradual, systematic way
examples: The company implemented a stepwise approach to digital transformation
Students learned the complex procedure through stepwise instruction

definitions: using two or more channels to create a spatial audio effect
examples: The stereo sound system filled the room with music
They upgraded from mono to stereo speakers last year

definitions: relating to sound reproduction using two or more independent audio channels
examples: The stereophonic recording captured the concert's full acoustic range
Modern stereophonic systems provide immersive listening experiences

definitions: relating to or denoting a process by which two images create three-dimensional perception
examples: The stereoscopic display created realistic 3D images without glasses
Surgeons use stereoscopic microscopes for precise operations

definitions: conforming to a fixed, oversimplified, and often prejudiced image or set of characteristics
examples: The movie featured stereotyped characters lacking depth or nuance
We must avoid stereotyped assumptions about different cultures

definitions: relating to or characterized by a stereotype or oversimplified conventional idea
examples: His stereotypical view of teenagers ignored their individuality
The advertisement avoided stereotypical gender roles

definitions: free from bacteria or other living microorganisms completely clean
unable to produce offspring or seeds, not fertile
lacking in imagination, creativity, or excitement unproductive
examples: The surgeon worked in a completely sterile operating room
All medical instruments must be sterile before use
The sterile hybrid plants could not produce viable seeds
Medical tests confirmed that he was sterile
The sterile office environment stifled creative thinking
Their sterile conversation lacked any genuine emotion

definitions: made free from bacteria or other living microorganisms by cleaning or heating
examples: The nurse used sterilized equipment for the procedure
Baby bottles should be properly sterilized before first use

definitions: relating to British money or the standard of silver purity
excellent or valuable in quality, character, or reputation
examples: The sterling silver flatware was a wedding gift
The pound sterling remains an important global currency
She has a sterling reputation in the legal community
His sterling character made him the ideal candidate

definitions: serious and unrelenting especially in the assertion of authority and discipline
relating to or located at the rear part of a ship or boat
examples: The teacher gave a stern warning about cheating
His stern expression showed he meant business
The passengers gathered at the stern to watch dolphins
The stern section sustained damage in the storm

definitions: relating to or containing steroids or steroid-like chemical compounds
examples: The doctor prescribed steroidal medication for the inflammation
Some athletes abuse steroidal substances to enhance performance

definitions: cooked slowly in liquid at or below boiling point
drunk or intoxicated from consuming too much alcohol
examples: The stewed tomatoes added rich flavor to the sauce
Grandmother's stewed chicken was a family favorite
He came home completely stewed after the party
They were too stewed to drive home safely

definitions: adhering or tending to adhere to a surface or object
examples: The sticking door needs its hinges oiled immediately
Remove any sticking labels before recycling the containers

definitions: tending to stick to things or having an adhesive quality
involving difficult, awkward, or delicate problems or situations
examples: The sticky candy left residue on her fingers
The humid weather made everything feel sticky
It became a sticky situation when both friends asked for help
The negotiations reached a sticky point over salary

definitions: restrained, suppressed, or prevented from happening, developing, or being expressed
examples: Her stifled creativity finally found an outlet in painting
The stifled laughter could be heard throughout the library

definitions: making one feel constrained or oppressed, especially from heat or lack of air
preventing or constraining the development or expression of something
examples: The stifling heat made outdoor work nearly impossible
The stifling atmosphere in the crowded room was unbearable
The stifling regulations prevented innovation in the industry
Her stifling upbringing left little room for self-expression

definitions: born dead rather than alive at birth
having failed from the beginning or incapable of success
examples: The veterinarian delivered a stillborn calf last night
Support groups help parents cope with stillborn babies
The committee declared the proposal stillborn due to budget constraints
Their stillborn business venture never attracted investors

definitions: stiff and self-conscious or unnatural in manner, speech, or writing
examples: His stilted conversation made everyone feel uncomfortable at dinner
The actor's stilted delivery ruined the emotional scene

definitions: tending to increase activity, alertness, or energy in body or mind
examples: Coffee acts as a mild stimulant for most people
The doctor prescribed stimulant medication for her ADHD

definitions: encouraged or aroused to activity, interest, or increased functional activity
examples: The stimulated neurons showed increased electrical activity
Students felt stimulated by the challenging new curriculum

definitions: encouraging interest, enthusiasm, or increased activity in mind or body
examples: The professor led a stimulating discussion about ethics
Regular exercise provides stimulating benefits for mental health

definitions: causing a sharp, burning pain like that of being stung
harsh, biting, or hurtful in effect or intention
examples: The stinging nettle left red marks on her skin
Stinging raindrops pelted against the window
His stinging criticism hurt more than physical pain
The stinging rebuke left her in tears

definitions: unwilling to give or spend money, ungenerous with resources or help
examples: The stingy landlord refused to fix the broken heater
Don't be stingy with the chocolate chips in cookies

definitions: having a strong, unpleasant smell or odor
very bad, unpleasant, or of poor quality
examples: The stinking garbage needed immediate removal from the kitchen
We avoided the stinking pond during our nature walk
What stinking weather ruined our beach vacation plans
He was in a stinking mood all day

definitions: having a strong unpleasant smell informal term for malodorous
examples: The stinky cheese was actually quite delicious
His stinky socks needed immediate washing

definitions: emotionally moved, excited, or aroused to feeling
mixed or agitated by circular movement with implement
examples: She felt deeply stirred by the powerful speech
The stirred audience gave a standing ovation
The stirred paint showed a uniform color throughout
Make sure the sauce is properly stirred before serving

definitions: causing excitement, emotion, or strong feelings in others
beginning to move, be active, or show signs of life
examples: The general gave a stirring speech before battle
The stirring music brought tears to many eyes
The stirring breeze rustled through the autumn leaves
There were stirring signs of spring in the garden

definitions: joined, fastened, or repaired by sewing with needle and thread
examples: The stitched leather wallet showed excellent craftsmanship
Her beautifully stitched quilt won first prize

definitions: supplied with goods, materials, or inventory kept in storage
examples: The well stocked pantry contained everything needed for baking
Our fully stocked store has all camping equipment

definitions: broad and sturdily built having a short, solid, muscular physique
examples: The stocky wrestler had a low center of gravity
His stocky build made him perfect for rugby

definitions: enduring pain or hardship without showing feelings or complaining
examples: She remained stoic throughout the painful medical procedure
His stoic acceptance of bad news impressed everyone

definitions: under the influence of drugs, especially marijuana
pelted with or damaged by stones thrown as punishment
examples: He appeared stoned and confused at the meeting
The stoned teenagers giggled at everything
In ancient times, criminals were sometimes stoned
The stoned windows needed expensive repairs

definitions: covered with or full of small pieces of rock
showing no emotion, warmth, or sympathy in expression or manner
examples: The stony path hurt our feet through thin shoes
Crops struggled in the stony soil
She met his apology with stony silence
His stony face revealed nothing about his thoughts

definitions: brought to a halt, ceased movement, or prevented from continuing
examples: The stopped traffic created a long line of cars
All stopped clocks in the house showed different times

definitions: having a specified number of floors or levels in a building
examples: The three storeyed house overlooked the village square
Many storeyed buildings line the downtown streets

definitions: having the stated number of stories or floors
celebrated, famous, or having a rich history told in stories
examples: The five storied pagoda attracted many tourists
They lived in a two storied colonial house
The storied history of the castle spans eight centuries
She joined the storied ranks of Olympic champions

definitions: affected by or subject to storms or bad weather
full of angry or violent disagreement or emotional turmoil
examples: The stormy weather cancelled all outdoor events
Sailors avoided the stormy seas during hurricane season
Their stormy relationship finally ended in divorce
The meeting became stormy when budget cuts were announced
